div1.p: Johnson thanks Hench for the copy of his article.

div1.head: Letter from Lucius W. Johnson to Philip Showalter Hench, January 9, 1942

opener.dateline:
LUCIUS W. JOHNSON
CAPTAIN, MEDICAL CORPS, U. S. NAVY
U. S. NAVAL HOSPITAL PENSACOLA, FLA.
9 January, 1942.

div1.p:
Many thanks for your kindness in sending
me a copy of your ‘Conquerors of Yellow Fever’. I have
read it with great interest, and hope to use many of the
points in it.

For many years I have been collecting ma-
terial for an article on the history of yellow fever in
the Navy, with particular attention to its effect on the
strategy of all our wars, up to the world war. I find a
number of excellent leads in your article, and am most
grateful for them.
